paragraphs: On Sunday, September 28, the Ministry of Finance of the Czech Republic will hold an "Open Day" at its main building on Letenská Street in the center of Prague. As part of the event, all interested individuals will be able to freely explore the architecturally interesting premises and learn about the current affairs of the government department.

In addition to excursions, visitors can expect a rich accompanying program: a demonstration of the skills of service dogs of the Customs Service, a demonstration of the operation of the electronic revenue accounting system, a presentation about the daily life of the institution, various contests and quizzes, as well as a lecture on financial literacy.

The Minister of Finance Zbynek Stanura, heads of the State Representation in Property Affairs Department, and the heads of the Finance and Customs Departments will participate in the event. There will be a separate discussion with them.
🕙 The open house day will last from 10:00 to 16:00. Tours will be conducted every 15 minutes with a duration of about an hour.

🆓 Admission is free. No prior reservation is required, but if desired, you can fill out this form and reserve spots in the groups at 10:00, 11:00, 12:00, 13:00, 14:00, 15:00, and 16:00 to avoid waiting in line. You can also reserve a spot for the financial literacy lecture at the same time.
